entry.title: Jimmie Rodgers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jimmie Rodgers (pictured) is considered the "Father of Country Music"?

entry.title: Sivapardus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Sivapardus was larger than a leopard, smaller than a lion, and had a face like a cheetah?

entry.title: Alan Wace (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the archaeologist Alan Wace worked undercover for British intelligence during both world wars?

entry.title: Benton Harbor BASIC (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Benton Harbor BASIC was written by Gordon Letwin, who Heathkit management said once showed up with long hair, high-top sneakers and a velvet coat?

entry.title: Saw E Binnya (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Battle of Daybathwe ended shortly after the Myaungmya commander Saw E Binnya was assassinated by the Hanthawaddy commander Dein Mani-Yut, whom he thought was defecting to his side?

entry.title: the 1932 baseball game (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in the 1932 baseball game in which pitcher Eddie Rommel won his last game, he pitched 17 innings in relief, an American League record?

entry.title: Marina de Escobar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Spanish mystic Marina de Escobar founded a convent but never joined one?

entry.title: maritime shipping is making the ocean more acidic (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that maritime shipping is making the ocean more acidic?
